    Skills

    Soft Skills Every Engineer Needs in 2026

    ERA Editorial Team·2026-02-01

    Beyond Technical Competence


    In the Nigerian construction industry, technical skills are the minimum requirement. What separates good engineers from great ones — and what determines who gets promoted — are soft skills.


    We surveyed our 20+ partner companies to understand exactly which soft skills they value most.


    1. Communication


    Can you explain a structural issue to a non-technical client? Can you write a clear site report? Can you brief a foreman on the day's work without ambiguity?


    Engineers who communicate clearly save projects time and money. Those who can't create confusion, rework, and delays.


    2. Problem-Solving Under Pressure


    Construction sites are unpredictable. Materials arrive late, weather disrupts schedules, designs need modification on the fly. Employers want engineers who can think on their feet and propose solutions, not just identify problems.


    3. Teamwork and Collaboration


    A building project involves architects, structural engineers, M&E engineers, quantity surveyors, contractors, and clients — all working toward the same goal. Engineers who can collaborate across disciplines are invaluable.


    4. Time Management


    Managing multiple tasks, meeting deadlines, and prioritising effectively is essential on any construction project. An engineer who consistently delivers on time builds trust with both employers and clients.


    5. Leadership and Initiative


    Even at the graduate level, employers look for engineers who take initiative — who notice problems before they're told, who suggest improvements, and who can lead a small team when required.


    How ERA Develops These Skills


    Our programme dedicates a full module to soft skills development, including:

  1. Professional communication workshops
  2. Presentation and report writing practice
  3. Team-based project simulations
  4. Leadership and conflict resolution training

    5. These skills complement the technical training and are a key reason our graduates are so successful in their placements.

    Empowering civil & mechanical engineering graduates for the building environment.
